citation.article-title: Geobacillus jurassicus sp. nov., a new thermophilic bacterium isolated from a high-temperature petroleum reservoir, and the validation of the Geobacillus species.

p.s: Description of G. jurassicus sp. nov.
G. jurassicus (ju.ras.si’cus. N.L. masc. adj. jurassicus, of Jurassic, referring to the geological period of oil-bearing formation, from where the strains were isolated).
Cells are rod-shaped, motile due to peritrichous flagella and produce terminally located ellipsoidal spores in slightly swollen sporangia.
The cell wall is Gram positive.
The colonies grown on nutrient agar are round, mucous, colourless, and have a diameter of about 2 mm.
Aerobic and chemoorganotrophic.
Acids, but not gases, are produced from arabinose, cellobiose, galactose, glycerol, glucose, fructose, maltose, mannose, mannitol, ribose, sucrose and trehalose.
No acids are produced from adonitol, inositol, lactose, raffinose, rhamnose, sorbitol, sorbose, or xylose.

The utilized carbon and energy sources are hydrocarbons (C6, C10, C11, C14 and C16), methane-naphthenic oil, acetate, butyrate, pyruvate, lactate, benzoate, fumarate, succinate, malate, ethanol, peptone, tryptone, and yeast extract.
Can grow in nutrient broth and on potato agar.
Cannot grow on methanol, propanol, butanol, iso-butanol, phenol, phenylacetate, alanine, glutamate, serine, formate, propionate, and Simmons citrate agar.
Poor growth is observed on asparagine and glutamine.
Catalase-positive and produces NH3 from peptone.
Urea and tyrosine are not degraded.
Phenylalanine is not deaminated.
H2S, indole and dihydroxyacetone are not produced.
Aesculin, gelatin and starch are hydrolyzed.
Casein is not hydrolysed.
Does not grow autotrophically on H2+CO2 and does not ferment glucose with gas production.
The egg-yolk lecithinase, Voges–Proskauer and the methyl red tests are negative.
Fe2+ is not used as an electron acceptor.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite or dinitrogen.
Thermophilic.
Can grow at temperatures between 45 and 65 °C, with an optimum growth temperature of 58−60 °C.
Can grow within the pH range 6.4−7.8, with optimum growth at 7.0−7.2.
Can grow both in the absence of NaCl and in the presence of 5−5.5% (w/v) NaCl.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-15:0, iso-16:0 and iso-17:0.
The G+C content of DNA is 53.8−54.5 mol%.
Was isolated from the formation water of the high-temperature oilfield.
The type strain is DS1T (= VKM B-2301T,=DSM 15726T).
The reference strain is DS2 (= VKM B-2302,=DSM 15727).
